boardgame.name: Pizza the Pie
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Pizza The Pie is the beloved local pizza place. It prides itself on being family owned, despite no one really knowing who's actually running the place...

Do you ever feel like you're struggling to include specific locations in your game? Or maybe just want to spice things up with a new location? Well, this supplement has you covered! Designed to add a bit of flavor (and more potential plot hooks) to a game, Pizza The Pie is customizable to most games, given that it's supposed to be the beloved local pizza place. However, there should also be enough unique flavour for the MC to work with. This supplement was originally made for the Finally Finish Something 2021 jam, but I unfortunately missed the deadline.

boardgame.name: The Tentacular Club of the Cosmic Kraken
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

A single-page pocket sphere for Troika!

The Tentacular Club is the place to be seen. An immense nightclub inside an inter-dimensional being, packed with adventure and danger to some banging choons.

Includes six NPCs with their own agendas and adventure seeds as well as a hook for visiting the club.

Created for the #troikaspherejam

boardgame.name: The Hunting of the Mastodores
boardgame.description:
A single-page pocket sphere for Troika!

The Mastodores of Monterra exist for the hunt, are surprisingly nimble, annoyingly persistent and like to wear fancy hats and boots.

Will you be the hunters or the hunted?

Includes a background and new items.

Created for the #troikaspherejam

boardgame.name: The Face of Sul
boardgame.description:
A single-page pocket sphere for Troika!

The face of a god, mined by the Bargewright Guilds to craft and repair fabulous golden barges.

Will you head into the Scalplands, try to buy a barge or help a religious smuggler?

Includes new enemies and new items.

Created for the #troikaspherejam

boardgame.name: Rock & Roll City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It’s like 40 years ago. You want to rock and roll all night and party every day. You’re some dipshit Teens and you somehow got tickets to see the hottest rock band in the world tonight… until you got busted. Now, you’re desperate, you’re dumb, and you’ll do about anything to get into that show.

Rock & Roll City is a story-centric roleplaying game for 2+ players and a GM inspired by movies like Detroit Rock City, School of Rock, and Role Models.

User summary:

The 2-page game usually is distributed with an index-card-sized, 1-page character sheet.

boardgame.name: Wer kennt Magdeburg? das stadtquiz
boardgame.description:
Who knows their way around Ottostadt, the beautiful city on the Elbe?
With 500 questions you can find out who is a real connoisseur, or even discover something unknown.
The authors put a lot of emphasis on questions that define the true insider. There are also topics and events that you encounter on a daily basis, but which you hardly pay attention to. Many questions take the guessing and estimation factor into account, so not only "Magdeburg children", but also newcomers and tourists can enjoy this game - or roll one of the six jokers.
A quiz blast for the whole family that illuminates all topics in six levels of difficulty.

Player with the most points is the winner.

boardgame.name: Silverwood Grove
boardgame.description:
Beyond the borders of humanity lies a hidden glen; Silverwood Grove. A place where every tree, rock and plant has a purpose.

Silverwood Grove is a wonderfully illustrated card game set in a mythical Australian realm. Players must create their own woodland village by collecting resources, hiring and promoting employees, building and upgrading locations and research and developing their character and tribe.

Choose from a wide range of Australian woodland characters to play.

Select your region to begin building your empire.

With an innovative Turn Phase token, the power is literally in your hands to craft the greatest region of Silverwood Grove.

Will you join the noble Kakadu - traditional ancient creatures who are the eyes of Silverwood Grove and have a network of allies, spies and informers who let them shape this woodland realm to their own desires?

Or the young and friendly Daintree - influential, expansive and with a lot of potential?

Or the wisest of all - Flinders - admired for their foresight, secure in their strength and authority for the denizens that make Silverwood Grove their home?

Silverwood Grove is a 1-6 player game of Action Selection and Action Rotation, using an innovative Turn Phase Token that requires you to decide when to Turn, as it costs an Action (AP) to change to different action sides. In using the Turn Phase Token, players can collect and trade resources, and then use these Resources to fuel further actions. By synergising their strategy, players can Hire and Promote Employees, Build and Upgrade Locations, and further strategize their way to victory.

Silverwood Grove takes place over 10 rounds, with 5 actions per round, and plays in around 30 minutes. Players score their VP and the player with the most considered the winner and the creator of the greatest region of Silverwood Grove.

kickstarter collector's edition , new in shrink payment by bank transfer or crypto currency

boardgame.name: Rockabilly Rumble
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hey daddy-o, you think you a cool cat up on what’s the haps? Well pull up a chair and listen to how things are man. We all ain’t no bunch a greasers here. You got to know we dun seen the light and I aint talking sing a Hymn and pass the plate brother. Im talking bout since they dun sploded the H bomb in the pacific they unleased one of them Tiki curses or something another. One night at the late show some of us, us cool ones started to see THEM. You know the Kookys and Krazys that come out at night, well you will see, just you wait.

boardgame.name: Rocket Goons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

[In] Rocket Goons...you play space explorers in a (communist) retrofuturist world.

boardgame.name: SABOTAGE
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

SABOTAGE

I can't stand it, I know you planned it

I'mma set it straight, this Watergate!

Play as a maverick detective with one goal: take down the perp any way possible.

boardgame.name: Scandalous Goons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A referee controls and describes the world to players who then describe how their characters act in the world filled with manipulation, social climbing and political desperation.

boardgame.name: School Goons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A superintendent controls and describes the world to players who then describe how their students act in the school.

boardgame.name: Shroom Goons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

SHROOM GOONS is about little shroomfolk on big adventures!
All you need to play is this booklet, a couple six-sided dice, your friends and IMAGINATION!


Arm yourself with a sewing needle sword, a button shield, and ready your matchstick torch!
Shroom Goons have unique traits: do you have a Witch Butter body? Devil Fingers? Shoot hallucinogenic spores?
Whether you're fighting Smorks in the Fluorescent Neverglades, evading the giants of Suburbia, or engaging the faeries of K'Arkadia there's countless adventures to be had!

boardgame.name: Super Goons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A referee controls and describes the world to players who then describe how their characters act in the world.

boardgame.name: SOL1D_ST8
SOLID ST8
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

[Y]ou make robots built to carry the message of mankind long after it's death. Or, you know, whatever you want to do with Robots.

Expect strong flavours of cyberpunk and sci-fi, plus whatever you and your friends bring to the table. Remix, good luck, have fun!

boardgame.name: Space Goblins!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are also all barreling through space in a ship made of junk and scrap, how lucky! Your goal: to make it to Junktopia, the rogue planet in the middle of space, a utopia for the Goblins, with your ship intact and as much Junk as you can to further its beauty!

Space Goblins! is a HIGH CHAOS AND TRULY OUTRAGEOUS RPG meant for 2-5 players with rotating referee play and an emphasis on wild Goblin-created mayhem!

Use any interlocking plastic building block collection, such as Lego, as your Junk collection, building up and breaking down your Junk Ship as you play with all the other Goblins!

User summary:

The game is distributed in several formats to support various types of print output. The "Plain" version is a no-art version.

In addition, a 6-page PDF of game tables is available.

boardgame.name: Across Australia on Barnet Glass Tyres
boardgame.description:
Across Australia on Barnet Glass Tyres is a game dating from the early twentieth century. It is simple roll and move race that sees players circumnavigate the Australian continent. Starting in Perth in Western Australia players travel in an anticlockwise directions, moving their pieces by the roll of a dice and obeying instructions along the way which may hinder or help there travels. The winner is first back to Perth on space 93.

The game has some historical significance by highlighting some of Australia's racing pioneers, although mostly now forgotten.
Mentioned on the game board is a Francis Birtle, a colourful adventurer who set cycling and driving records from the 1900's to the 1920's. The game board reference is probably a 1912 epic journey from the Gulf of Carpentaria in remote northern Australia back to Melbourne.
The game board also gives reference to a Harold Parsons who held world motorcycle endurance records between 1916 and 1920

—user summary

boardgame.name: Protodroid DeLTA
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.




Inspired by the SNES classic Megaman X, Protodroid: DeLTA is a 3D action-platformer set in a Solarpunk world with a hopeful yet nonutopian vision of the future. The goal of the project is to successfully translate the fast & fluid 2D gameplay of the X series into 3D

Source: Steam.

boardgame.name: Ragnarok: Rise of the Buran Clan
boardgame.description:
The Rise of the Buran Clan expansion is the first expansion of the game. It introduces the main Buran Clan hero Aeria Buran as well as many of her accompanying cards.

The Buran Clan expansion has many unique great creatures and powerful spells.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ilustres Ignorantes "El Juego"
boardgame.description:
Test your wit and intelligence with the game of the Movistar+ program. An original idea by Javier Coronas, Pepe Colubi and a little more by Javier Cansado, developed by David Vaquero. A game of cards and dice in which you take on the role of the program's host and guests in a fight to be the most illustrious. Knowledge and stupidity are guaranteed in equal parts.

—description from the designer

Pon a prueba tu ingenio y tu inteligencia con el juego del programa de Movistar+. Una idea original de Javier Coronas, Pepe Colubi y un poquito más de Javier Cansado, desarrollada por David Vaquero. Un juego de cartas y dados en el que tomarás el rol de presentador e invitados del programa en una lucha por ser el más Ilustre. Conocimiento y estupidez están garantizadas a partes iguales.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

boardgame.name: Secret Society
boardgame.description:
2 player deck-builder and area-control game set in the shadow world of the Illuminati and their rival secret societies.

Players take charge of historical secret societies such as:
a. The Illuminati - master puppet masters from the shadows
b. Opus Dei - Fanatical religious enforcers of Order and Divine Justice
c. The Black Dragons - Ruthless Military and Criminal Masterminds
d. Ordo Templis Orientis - Occult practitioners of Black Magic and Cabalistic Ritual

Players must build their deck with Military, Economic, Criminal, Religious, Judicial and Occult action cards - which when played, allow provide a variety of powerful effects such a launching military invasions, bribing local politicians and even summoning Elder Gods through human sacrifice.

The goal of the game is to either have more influence than your opponent in all 6 continents (the 6 areas of the Board), or knock out your opponent by exposing their nefarious schemes to the Public.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Destination Great Britain
boardgame.description: Drive your taxi around Great Britain, competing with other drivers to collect the most fares and finish first.

boardgame.name: Ah-So
boardgame.description:
The objective is to capture as many of your opponent's pieces as possible. This is done by sandwiching one or more of his pieces between two of yours.

In addition to regular pieces, each player receives four face pieces. There are five home dots at the center of the board. Each face piece placed next to a home dot scores two points at the end of a game. All other pieces score one point. The game ends when all the pieces are played or when neither player can make a move.

Tradition requires the winning player to suck in his breath and say "ah- s-o-o-o-o" at the end of the game.

boardgame.name: Scythe: ScytheKick
boardgame.description: ScytheKick is an unoffical companion to the board game Scythe, produced with permission of the game designer. The app facilitates solo play by playing the Automa cards. Users can set the difficulty level for one Automa. ScytheKick draws random cards for turns and combat, maintains the star tracker, and automatically changes cards from Phase I to Phase II.

boardgame.name: Quest World™
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Quest World™ is a glitchy pocketmod sphere for Troika!

Quest World™ was once a thriving community of avid pseudo-medieval role players and puzzle-solvers. Alas, the mods have long since abandoned this world, bots have overrun the land, and its servers desperately need maintenance. Still, riches abound for those who seek, and a forsaken populace seeks heroes. So boot up your PC terminal, jack in your WetWare implants, keep a dream journal under your pillow, or follow the signs between the spheres and get ready for Quest World™!

boardgame.name: Colours and Guns
boardgame.description:
Colours & Guns an 80 page set of land based rules system designed for 10 mm Napoleonic figures. They will whet your appetite for Napoleonic wargaming in our speciality scale, 10 mm. The rules are simple enough to get a grasp of quickly but have enough variety and complexity to make it a game you'll want to play again and again. With so many nations to choose from where will you begin……? The rules are choc full of photos, diagrams, army lists and sketches of some of the most famous Commanders of the day. We've placed the quick play sheet on the back cover, so they don't take up much room on the table and the spine of the book stays neat. Units are infantry battalions, cavalry regiments or batteries of guns.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Magnytour Profil: Tour de Suisse
boardgame.description: The Tour de Suisse is a 6-stage race on the UCI World Tour calendar taking place annually in June

boardgame.name: Triathlon
boardgame.description:
A trick taker for three players in which you try to complete a "triathlon" by accomplishing three tasks: winning a number of tricks equal to a multiple of three (3, 6, 9, or 12 tricks,) winning the last trick of the hand, and winning the "middling" number of tricks (neither the least or the most.)

If you complete a triathlon in one hand, you immediately win! Otherwise, whichever player is able to first complete three triathlons across multiple hands wins.

The game is played with a 39 card deck: A-6 in four suits, plus three jokers.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Magnytour Profil: Tour Down Under
boardgame.description:
The Tour Down Under is a professional cycling stage race run around the Australian city of Adelaide.
Run for the first time in 1999, since 2008 it has been the first round on the UCI ProTour calendar, today the World Tour.

A race in 5 stages of 150 km each.

boardgame.name: Magnytour Profil: Paris-Nice
boardgame.description:
Paris-Nice is a French professional stage cycling race.

Created in 1933, it is organized by Amaury Sport Organization.

It takes place in March for eight days, making it the first major stage race of the year in Europe.

boardgame.name: Magnytour Profil: Course Tirreno-Adriatico
boardgame.description:
The between two seas Tirreno-Adriatico race offers some very nice playing profiles.

The stage race profile consists of 3 stage profiles, it is Magnytour-specific and is updated annually.

boardgame.name: Magnytour Profil: Course Classique – Championnat du Monde
boardgame.description:
The profile is specific for each race and adapted to the Magnytour game. It is updated every year. You can therefore order the new edition every year.

The 2019 edition of the UCI Road World Championships – Men's road race was help in Yorkshire.

boardgame.name: Doctor! Doctor!: Man vs Meeple Season 3 Promo Card
boardgame.description:
A single Promo card for Doctor! Doctor! Mix in with the rest of the cards and proceed as usual.

The card is worth 7 VP. Requirements: 2 lungs, 1 heart, 1 bone.
Blood Pressure = 6

Originally available through the Man vs Meeple's 2020 Kickstarter.

boardgame.name: BATSU!: The Punishment Card Game
boardgame.description:
BATSU! is a party card game where players compete in hilarious challenges to avoid humiliating or mildly painful punishments!


Based on the hit live Japanese punishment game show in NYC and Chicago
Put your “funny” friends to the test in challenges while risking a BATSU!
Everyone wins, except the loser!


Compete In Challenges
Each round a different player is the judge. The judge of the round draws a Challenge Card for the other players to compete in. These could be anything from telling a story to acting as props for a play.

Audience Suggestions
There is a deck of audience suggestions to switch things up every time a challenge is drawn. Different challenges require different types of suggestions. For example, the judge may draw a Place Card so the scene could take place anywhere from a baseball field to Mars.

Hilarious Punishments
The judge then decides which player did the worst and deserves to be punished, Japanese game show style! It could be something humiliating like calling a friend to tell an embarrassing story about you, or painful like getting an arm hair plucked out! In the end, players are either funny or get punished!

boardgame.name: Heathcliff .... Munch Out Board Game Card Game
boardgame.description:
Based on the comic strip by George lately. Be the first to collect a complete 10 course meal for Heathcliff to eat.


Players roll dice to move across the board
Collect 9 numbered meals or 8 and the joker-card
Use shortcuts to get to the dishes first or trade meals with adjacent players
The first player to serve all 9 dishes to Heathcliff wins

boardgame.name: Hexa Würfel-Domino
boardgame.description:
Hexa without a die:
All 48 tokens are mixed up and placed upside down on the central area of the game board. The players chose a token and set it on the corresponding space in the area with the border of their color. If a token can't be placed, it ist placed upside down beside the game board and the next player get his turn. When the central spaces are empty, the tokens beside the game board are mixed up and placed in the central area to resume play. The first player to place 12 tokens in the area of his color wins the game.

Hexa with a die:
All 48 tokens are mixed up and placed upside down on the central area of the game board. When all tokens are placed, they are turned to show their nominations. Now the players roll a die ant take a corresponding token to pace in their area. If the token lay on a corresponding center space, the player gets another turn. On the roll of a 6 the player gets another turn too. If his two sixes are already covered, the 6 count as a wildcard. The first player to place 12 tokens in the area of his color wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Fussball-Spiel zu Hause
boardgame.description:
Each player has 11 pawns (green vs. yellow). The ball is represented by a black pawn. Playing time is 2x15 minutes.
The movement (not diagonally) of the ball and the player pawns is determined by a die. Only at the roll of a 6 the ball may move over other pawns. If the ball stops in front of a pawn of the same team or the pawn moves behind the ball, the player may roll again.
The player with the most goals wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Funny Pages: A Comical Puzzle Game
boardgame.description:
Use your wits, code-breaking skills, and real-world research to crack a series of challenges hidden in hilarious cartoon panels.

If you can uncover their mysteries and piece together the big picture, you may be able to smash open an enigmatic cold case of the missing cartoonist.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Spellslingers X Otherworlds
boardgame.description:
Spellslingers X Otherworlds is an exciting and new stand alone expansion for Spellslingers!
You don't need to have any knowledge of Spellslingers or Otherworlds to completely enjoy this game!

This new set contains 60 cards, 12 of which are characters! Every card is inspired by the Otherworlds tabletop RPG.

The other 48 cards are spells, each relating to one of the 12 characters, adding more story to the game than ever before!

boardgame.name: Line-ups
boardgame.description:
Line-ups is an N-in-a-row game played on a 12x12 grid. Players take turns marking one space. When a player completes one or more rows of three, four, or five spaces in a line they score it. A scored row may be extended to make a longer row, but not an overlapping row of the same size.

The winner is the first player to score eight rows of three, five rows of four, or one row of five.

To offset the first-player advantage players may optionally not count the first row of three scored by that player.

boardgame.name: Spy Goons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The team has arrived and with what little time formulated a plan only they can pull off. Desert Cobra sneaks through the kitchen to borrow a uniform and delivery cart, Silver Lotus climbs the rear of the building toward the penthouse, and Scattered Sunlight slips through the crowded party making her way towards the guest of honor.

Spy Goons is a one page table top role playing game of stealth action for a GM and 2 or more players. Inspired by spy and action movies Spy Goons begins as your team moves towards completing their latest mission. It uses only 2 six-sided dice and some paper or notecards per player.

boardgame.name: Subway Goons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It started as just another normal day. You got on the subway. But then things got... weird.

Subway Goons...explores the banal and surreal things that happen when you enter a different and altogether stranger set of tunnels: the NYC Subway.

boardgame.name: Sunken Lover Refracta
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Refracta is set in an oceanic limbo where black-and-white cartoons are banished when their time is up.

From the introduction:

A procedural oceanic cartoon limbo.

User summary:

This item is intended for use with (and requires the use of) The Eternal Caverns of Urk.

boardgame.name: The Sultan's Goons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Guard the periphery around the Sultan's favorite palace or lose your head! An analog adventure game in a desert realm...

User summary:

The Sultan's Goons is a short scenario and simple game setting.

boardgame.name: Thrash Dogs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The year is 2027 and the Parent's Music Resource Center, led by Android God Emperor Tipper Gore, now controls all aspects of American culture. It's going to take quick wits and sick tricks to reclaim the streets - will you thrash hard enough?

boardgame.name: Trouble Tunes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are a small, up-and-coming band! Your goal is to become famous and amazing, and you’re going to do it by winning the upcoming Battle of the Bands, thereby getting the attention of record producers and fans worldwide!

You have a few small issues between you and success, though. The first one is that there are, like, a hundred bands competing in this challenge. Some of them are even going to be doing head-to-head challenges, and those are hard!

Also, you have about three songs and none of you have had time to practice.

Also at any given moment you’re about five seconds away from having a meltdown and storming off to your dressing room.

But aside from that, you’re ready to go! You’ve got your sweet instruments, some fancy costume changes, and you’re going to show the world what a cool set of musicians you are.

boardgame.name: Tunnel Crawlers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The City is older than any mortal memory can reach, written or dreamt. Outside are the Nightlands, an empty and forlorn realm of death and ruins. We inhabit these halls and towers of the city, illuminated by the Light Tower.

But in the tunnels deep below the City there is a dark and mythical Underworld filled with dangers, creatures and treasures of the long past eras. The City is our last Bastion against the Darkness. So we seek to defend it with all we have, knowing that if we fail, nothing will prevail.

Equip your gear! We are send to crawl down the tunnels of the realm below.

This is a simple and streamlined adventure roleplaying game set in a grim dark fantasy city and the mythical underworld in the guts of the city below.

boardgame.name: Visitors and Goons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Visitors and Goons is intentionally a horror game, more in the lines of suspense. Here we’re talking about the chills that you got when watching Alien or the gore from The Thing. So make sure that everybody is, at least, comfort with the idea. However, play was you like it.

boardgame.name: Vooid Goons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A referee controls and describes the world to players who then describe how their characters act in the world.

boardgame.name: ~Writhe~
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Survive your curse in a blighted land for as long as you can.

From the introduction:

An analog adventure game for nice people.

boardgame.name: Yokai Hunters Society
boardgame.description:
A rules-light pen & paper RPG about monster hunters in Meiji Japan.

Publisher's blurb:

The year is 1889. After months of deliberation, a Constitution is about to be approved, giving absolute power to Emperor Meiji. In the last two decades, there have been profound political and social reforms that have cleared the way for “modernization:” the abolition of feudal privileges, the establishment of European-style political, police, and judicial systems, restructuring of the army, etc. But not everyone is happy with these changes.

In these convulsive years, yokai sightings and encounters have increased tremendously. Some blame the barbarians, others accuse nostalgics of the bakufu times, and a few even dare to hold His Majesty responsible. The truth is nobody knows the reason behind the uptick in sightings for sure.

The Yokai Gari Kai, or Yokai Hunters Society, has been around for centuries, gathering brave people from any social stratum willing to fight these abominations that lurk in the shadows.

The adventures you can play range from facing the monster of the week, to complex investigations or political plots, to routine cleansing jobs. A horror-genre approach to the game’s stories is recommended, with bonus points if it gestures towards the psychological horror characteristics of many Japanese films and comics.

User summary:

The game is formatted to be printed as two double-sided, tri-fold pamphlets: "Hunter's Panphlet" (sic) and "Grandmaster's Panphlet" (sic). Two formats are available - one has larger margins for easier printing.

boardgame.name: Generic Dragon
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The subject of countless myths from every corner of the world, Dragons are as varied as the cultures who tell of them. The common threads are clear, however: Dragons are old, powerful, and awesome. Now, you have the opportunity to be one.

boardgame.name: Adventures in Babysitting Squids
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

While traveling in the cold lands of Icewind Dale, the adventurers see a strange flying ship being chased by dragons that damage part of the ship. When the party goes to investigate the parts of the ship that droped they are presented with an unexpected new friend A Squidling.

Tier 2 (Level 5-10) for the Adventure League Plague of Ancients campaign. With around 2 hours of play.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Undisclosed Ordeals
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

With the Frostmaiden’s grasp over Icewind Dale crushing spirits and snuffing out hope, the frozen north is a dismal place. No one has answers, and no one can say for sure when Auril’s curse will be lifted, so it’s only to be expected that political devilment seems to have thrived in these times. When a wealthy merchant in Bryn Shander requests help on behalf of a friend, who knows what long hidden secrets they’ll uncover along the way.

A 4-hour adventure for 1st – 4th level characters. It contains mentions of undead, Isolation (ironic in these trying times I know), and some horror elements.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: I'm In Your Arms
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The barkeep at The Luskan Arms runs into a lost love–but the authorities have selected her as the sacrifice! Will the adventurers find a way to spare her? Will love endure the frost or fall victim to the rime?

This adventure is designed for three to seven characters, level 5 through 10, and is optimized for five characters with the average party level (APL) of 8. Characters outside this level range cannot participate in this adventure. This adventure occurs in Targos, one of the TenTowns in Icewind Dale, and is based on the Holy Auril, Mother of Cod hook from the Dungeoncraft – Plague of Ancients program. I’m In Your Arms is also the second adventure of the Targos Ascending series, following A Front on Frost. Only Season 10 Characters may earn rewards from this adventure if following Adventurers League rules. This adventure is heavily inspired by the movie Casablanca.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: The Crystalline Caverns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tucked away within this partially-eroded mountain lies a cavern, glowing with dappled rainbows. Light reflects off colorful crystals, some red, others blue, purple or yellow. They ring slightly, thrumming with some kind of innate power.

The verdant green ferns and wildflowers stop before you reach the cavern. There are no signs of animals within, either, despite many habitable tunnels breaking away from the main cavern, and leading deeper into the mountain.

To enter this hair-raising place, you must first cross a steep, rocky gorge. Beyond that wait the statues of robed figures, holding swords and guarding the entrance.

boardgame.name: Lake Village of Obira
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Flowers and waterlilies bloom along boardwalks in this Japan-inspired fishing village. Schools of fish swim in and out of the shadows beneath the docks, while boats bob gently against their mooring lines.

The sweet scent of cherry blossom drifts on the breeze, mingling with that of the fresh seafood, stored in deep nets. Barrels of fish oil are piled high alongside crates of dried, salt-packed fillets.

Beneath the blossoming tree is a small stone shrine with a stick of incense. It is where the locals come to worship; often asking for a blessing on their next catch, or continued safety and peace.

Adventure Seed

‘Stop before it’s too late! This is against our traditions!’ You hear an old man yell. Turning, you see him pushed down by a soldier. ‘You don’t understand what you’re doing!’ Pleads the scraggly-looking man, struggling to rise. ‘If you continue to over-fish like this, you’ll break our accord!’

The soldier laughs and glances at her team, who are busily loading crates and barrels onto a cart. ‘Your superstitions won’t protect us from this war, only our allies will. Now, begone hermit!’

‘I arrived too late,’ the man whimpers as you hear a rushing noise. Turning, you’re drenched with a tall wave. Blinking away water, you glimpse a silvery-green tail, as long as several men and nearly as thick. It disappears amidst the houses ahead of you, breaking them apart and leaving floating timber in its wake…

What’s happening? Generations ago refugees fled a tyrant, traversing treacherous mountains to survive. It appeared they would starve until they found the lake, but when they cast nets a huge, green Asian Lung dragon emerged; it’s eyes glowing white, its long body coiling and twisting like a serpent’s.

The refugees believed the monster would be their death. Instead, the dragon spoke to them, saying they could fish and even find sanctuary in the lake, so long as they only took what they needed to survive, and no more. So the village was founded.

Generations later, their pact with the dragon has fallen into superstition. Caught between two warring nations, the villagers chose to increase their production and provide supplies to the stronger army, in return for protection against the aggressing nation.

The hermit, who lives alone on the far side of the lake, has often claimed to have conversations with the dragon, but the villagers dismissed him as delusional. A friend to the Lung, he was gifted a Cosmic Pearl, which he uses to magically replenish his food stores once a day. If the dragon survives, he will gift it to you in thanks for a peaceful resolution.

boardgame.name: Icy Lake Village of Obira
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Boats bob gently against their mooring lines along icy boardwalks in this Japan-inspired fishing village.

The sweet scent of cherry blossom drifts on the breeze, mingling with that of the fresh seafood, stored in deep nets. Barrels of fish oil are piled high alongside crates of dried, salt-packed fillets.

Beneath the blossoming tree is a small stone shrine with a stick of incense. It is where the locals come to worship; often asking for a blessing on their next catch, or continued safety and peace.

boardgame.name: Bio-Hazard Village Ruins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Radio-active pulsating light suffuses the air within this crumbling village where broken boardwalks and muddy bone encrusted mounds of earth are common.

The scent of damp earth wafts on the breeze, mingling with that of the rotting timber. Damaged barrels of fish oil are piled high alongside crates of dried, salt-packed fillets which have been mostly raided. Derelict buildings crumble, tiles falling from their roofs and supporting structures giving away to leave deadly gaps in the higher boardwalks.

boardgame.name: Ruins of Obira
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Flowers and waterlilies bloom along the broken boardwalks where schools of fish swim in and out of the shadows beneath the docks in this Japan-inspired fishing village.

The sweet scent of cherry blossom drifts on the breeze, mingling with that of the rotting timber. Damaged barrels of fish oil are piled high alongside crates of dried, salt-packed fillets which have been mostly raided.

Beneath the blossoming tree is a small stone shrine with a stick of incense. It is where the locals used to come to worship; often asking for a blessing on their next catch, or continued safety and peace a blessing which was not granted.

boardgame.name: Blood Mist Village Ruins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Magical red mist suffuses the air and plants within this crumbling village, flowers and waterlilies bloom in bloody water along the broken boardwalks and muddy bone encrusted mounds of earth.

The scent of damp earth wafts on the breeze, mingling with that of the rotting timber. Damaged barrels of fish oil are piled high alongside crates of dried, salt-packed fillets which have been mostly raided. Derelict buildings crumble, tiles falling from their roofs and supporting structures giving away to leave deadly gaps in the higher boardwalks.

boardgame.name: Icy Ruins of Obira
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The sweet scent of cherry blossom drifts on the breeze, mingling with that of the rotting timber in this Japan-inspired fishing village. Ice clings to the broken boardwalks of this village where damaged barrels of fish oil are piled high alongside crates of dried, salt-packed fillets which have been mostly raided.

Beneath the blossoming tree is a small stone shrine with a stick of incense. It is where the locals used to come to worship; often asking for a blessing on their next catch, or continued safety and peace a blessing which was not granted.

boardgame.name: Ruins of Darkwater Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Flowers and waterlilies bloom in grimy water along the broken boardwalks and muddy bone encrusted mounds of earth.

The scent of damp earth wafts on the breeze, mingling with that of the rotting timber. Damaged barrels of fish oil are piled high alongside crates of dried, salt-packed fillets which have been mostly raided. Derelict buildings crumble, tiles falling from their roofs and supporting structures giving away to leave deadly gaps in the higher boardwalks.

boardgame.name: Akari's Refuge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Weary from your journey along the steep, frozen road, you are glad to arrive at Akari’s Refuge. It is well known amongst those who traverse the mountain range, and is protected against the harsh snow storms that occasionally descend.

Akari, a beautiful young woman with long, white hair emerges, wearing a monk’s kimono. She welcomes you inside her small home for warm jasmine tea and sweet mochi. When you are finished, she sets the table with many little bowls and plates of delicious hot food, and invites you to enjoy the meal.

Afterwards, as you leave her home and enter the courtyard, you begin to feel extremely drowsy. Spider legs the length of Akari’s body emerge from her back, and you hear the echoes of many feet scuttling throughout the surrounding tunnels—heading in your direction.

Spiders the size of small dogs emerge. Akari smiles and shrugs, “My children need to eat as well.”

What’s happening? The real Akari was killed weeks ago by a Jorogumo; a giant, female spider that can take the shape of seductive women. The monster assumed Akari’s form and has been using her refuge as a way to lazily feed upon the travelers who arrive, thanks to its good reputation.

She poisoned the main meal with a slow-acting agent and has now invited her small-spider children to partake of THEIR meal, as well.

If you explore the spider-tunnels to their end, you’ll find egg chambers filled with bodies encased in cocoons. Among them is the corpse of a woman with long, white hair wearing a gold hairpiece and clutching an ivory serving spoon. The spoon is blessed, and makes food cooked with it tastier; restoring extra health when consumed.

boardgame.name: Demon's Gate
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Burning embers rise from rivers of lava, lapping against an isle engraved with the pentagram and surrounded by six pillars. Chains drape from stone to scorched stone, and an ancient gate engraved with ruins waits beyond.

Tunnels—many of them filled with magma—break away from the main cavern, leading deeper into this burning hell.

To enter, you must first cross a steep, rocky gorge filled with glowing, molten stone. Beyond that wait the statues of robed figures, clasping swords and guarding the entrance.

boardgame.name: Bone Collector's Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tucked away within this partially-eroded mountain lies a weather-beaten altar, piled high with bones. An icy stream surrounds it, encircled by pillars. Beyond waits an ancient stone gate, runes carved into its surface.

Tunnels—many of them filled with water—break away from the main cavern, leading deeper into the mountain.

To enter this shadowy place, you must first cross a steep, rocky gorge. Beyond that wait the statues of robed figures, holding swords and guarding the entrance.

boardgame.name: Gates of the Fallen
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Glowing red embers rise from rivers of blood, lapping against an isle engraved with the pentagram and surrounded by six pillars. Chains drape from stone to blackened stone, and an ancient gate engraved with ruins waits beyond.

Wind howls eerily, carrying with it the stench of death, and decay. Tunnels break away from the main cavern, leading deeper into this crimson, demonic hell.

To enter, you must first cross a steep, rocky gorge fed by a waterfall of blood. Beyond that wait the statues of robed figures, clasping swords and guarding the entrance.

boardgame.name: The Treasury (Issue #4)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bonus Giant-sized issue! In this issue: Hex crawl “Isle of the Whale: Valaiden Saari”, an arctic island adventure easy to drop into your home campaign. The PCs have a map of a northern island and the whaling station that appears to be the only point of civilization. Can they battle the freezing cold and the creatures that inhabit this unforgiving realm? An old school styled adventure for PCs level 10.

boardgame.name: Builders Pack 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

New Wooden Walkway tiles in 2 variants – Nails or Rope Tied.

Standalone Plank assets, Plank Bridges, Wooden Fence tiles, Ladders updated to match new wood colors.

Total # of Assets in this pack: 892!

boardgame.name: Dungeon Decor Pack 02
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The follow up to the modular mine tracks release.

This one contains all the other things you need to decorate your mines!
From carts, to cranes, to hand tools, this pack has a huge assortment of mining equipment, including some things you will probably need to research to know what they are.

Total # of Assets in this pack: 673!

boardgame.name: Dungeon Decor Pack 03
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

More assets to decorate your caves, mines and other underground places.

This one contains Crystals and Geodes in various types and shapes!

Total # of Assets in this pack: 2,561!

boardgame.name: Terrain Textures Pack 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

New textures incoming!

So with our recent expansion of flora, I felt like we really needed new ground textures to compliment them. So this pack has some revamped Grass textures a lot of new mud/dirt textures, couple of forest floors and more!

Next texture pack already in works, as textures are one of the most important building blocks and we just want to expand the selection as much as possible.

Total # of Textures in this pack: 96!

boardgame.name: Terrain Textures Pack 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

New textures incoming!

A bunch of new Tile flooring, including marble, and various rocky tiles. New Water textures, New Rock textures + couple of “generic” Terrain textures that are very versatile and can be used for almost anything.

Next Texture pack will include new Wooden Flooring in various patterns!

Total # of Textures in this pack: 238!

boardgame.name: Battlemap Mine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap Mine is 45x45 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Battlemap Snow Manor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap Snow Manor is 40x40 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Battlemap Tomb
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap Tomb is 29x29 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Battlemap Tunnel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap Tunnel is 25x45 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: 100 Modern Business Drop Ins 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different modern business names and descriptions that are ready to populate the various buildings and shopping centers on your urban location map. The designer of this 100 list offers a wide variety of businesses for the GM to quickly roll up or manually assign. Some places are better to drop into the seedy side of town while others are more appropriate for the nicer areas. Some locations are struggling per descriptive while others are thriving or have positive qualities. Some locations would make for good adventure worthy encounters or settings while others are more suitable as “bystander fluff”.

Though best suited for modern/crime, super hero settings, etc., this product could also be easily used to name off businesses for post apocalyptic locations or provide common "everyday" shops for near future dystopian or cyberpunk settings. Also suitable for urban backdrops for zombie outbreaks and other modern horror.

boardgame.name: 100 Professionals Set 24
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different professionals that are perfect drop ins for a modern/crime role playing game. This list is also useful for survivors for a post apocalyptic or zombie outbreak setting as well as a cyberpunk/near future dystopia that has many existing modern day occupations and elements. Included in each entry is first and last name, gender, age, and occupational skill/role.

boardgame.name: 100 Millionaires 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This 100 list features a whole bunch of millionaires for your modern era campaign. Some folks have barely broke their first million while other entries are more suited for multi-millionaires who are steadily working towards breaking into the billionaire territory. Each entry includes first and last name, gender, age, role/occupation, and a general descriptive.

Use these folks as associates to criminals, victims of criminals, annoying people the characters have to deal with, innocent bystanders, crooked influences, or anything else you may need for a modern/crime, superhero campaign, or otherwise.

boardgame.name: The Flood
boardgame.description:
Designed by Bedouin Games and Iden.team Illustrated by Ben Maier, Macro Paganessi, sculpted by Renan Assuncao and Ludwik Lukaszewski. The Flood is a euro-style game with Dice/ resource and event mechanics as well as 140+ miniatures.

In The Flood players are taken back in time to the pre historic world before the flood. Their objective is to build a network of Huts and Camps and collect enough resources to build the Ark before the flood. Each player can obtain a Mammoth- the hero miniature that can collect strategic resources as well. Each turn players will roll the tool and two commodity dice to collect resources from their structures on the triangular hexagons. Commodities include: Gopher wood, Tar, Wool, Vegetables, Limestone and water.

The board includes 23 triangular hexagons that are set up with the board edges being the weather markers. Tool tokens are placed on each triangular hexagon. When the correct commodity and Tool is rolled the players will receive resources. During their turns players will build and collect commodity cards, resource tokens, move the mammoths as well as obtain story cards. Story cards control the weather and offer multiple other bonuses and negative effects. Players can choose to strategically purchase re-rolls of the dice to potentially gain an advantage.

Trading is a strategic part of the game. Players are able to trade resource cards with each other, the supply in two different ways. All players may loose if none finish building the ark before the flood.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 50 Planetary Stations
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The inhabited worlds of the galaxy are dotted with numerous outposts, settlements, stations, and space port colonies. This guide offers 50 of such locations for you to populate your planetary maps with. Included in each entry is the station colony name, total population number, number of buildings, primary purpose of the station, and a descriptive/condition of the station.

boardgame.name: 50 Planetary Stations 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The inhabited worlds of the galaxy are dotted with numerous outposts, settlements, stations, and space port colonies. This guide offers 50 of such locations for you to populate your planetary maps with. Included in each entry is the station colony name, total population number, number of buildings, primary purpose of the station, and a descriptive/condition of the station.

boardgame.name: Habitation Pods
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Pods in furnished and unfurnished version for the creation of a scifi city

Ask yourself: are they individual pods, stacks, spheres with ascending sized floors? Space needle like saucers on sticks on a planet side city or a station floating in space? You decide! Goes great with my city so gritty or scifi decor sets. Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: City Streets
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

20 Sections of Near-Future City, without interiors

Need some cityscapes for your mech combat, open gang warfare, or to fill around a section your players will enter? This addition gives you plenty of exterior spaces to expand you city outwards. Goes great with my other City so Gritty sets. Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Main Streets
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

18 Sections of Modular Near-Future City, without interiors

Need some cityscapes with streets wide enough for your battlemech? This set should give you enough exterior spaces to expand your city outwards and increase its traffic problems considerably! Goes great with my other City so Gritty sets.

Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: 100 Dangerous Plants
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The world is filled with monsters for characters to encounter and slay, leaving the scenery to fade into the background. However, the menacing forest itself could be after our brave heroes just as much as the goblins and ghouls within. Add dangerous flora to the foreboding swamp, or set a seaweed trap on the seemingly benign beach. Should you stop to smell the flowers, they might just bite back. An innocent breeze, or a careless sweep of the sword, could send up a cloud of poisonous spores. Or there could be more than the wind rustling the leaves in the man-eating trees. Make the environment in your campaigns come alive with these dangerous plants lying in wait to ambush your players when they least suspect.

There are ten different terrain types in which to find plants, each of which has ten plants to find.

boardgame.name: 100 Floors to Find in a Dungeon (PF)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Floors. All dungeons will have them at some point. In some cases, the floors may be important, relevant or dangerous. In others, the floors will simply be scenery. This supplement has 100 different floors that can be used within a dungeon to flesh out a room. Some of them may appear important or puzzling, but none have any game effect unless the GameMaster decides otherwise.

boardgame.name: 100 Things in a Ruined Outpost (Fantasy)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Outposts can be a castle, a keep, a tower, a lighthouse, a forest tree house, or even mountain structure that exists as part of a communication network. They can be ruined by warfare, disease, treachery, opposing nations or the wrath of an angry god. In the aftermath, the forces of chaos frequently move back into the outpost and rest in the wreckage. This list is intended for any fantasy setting where arcane and divine magic is abundant, and monsters fight tooth and nail for their piece of a crowded world. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to a lonely speck of civilization lost in the wilderness.

boardgame.name: 200 Names of Cyber City Clubs & Pubs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bars. Pubs. Clubs. Taverns. Every one has a favorite in Cyber City. Whether you’re a cop or criminal, a tech or a wreck, nomad or madman, everyone has a place where they go to hang out and relax, or just retreat into and feel nothing at all.

This list is for any dark future game setting (like Cyberpunk Red, Cyberpunk 2020, Carbon 2185, Shadowrun, Aeon Punk, Altered Carbon, GURPS Cyberpunk, Android, etc.) where rumors, rock music, food, and lonely people hang out and interact. Or get drunk and smash heads. Game Masters are strongly encouraged to select a theme for the bar - such as a veterans bars, beer hall, brewpub, cocktail lounge, hotel bar, biker bar, nightclub, dance club, classic “fern” bar, an executive/private bar, karaoke bar, wine bars, sports bar, etc. Finally, there are also a few fight clubs designed for combat (these spots feature gambling related to injuries and body count and will usually limit weapons).

boardgame.name: My Daddy was a Demon! (100 Tiefling Traits)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tieflings. Cambions. Alu-demons. They are born with the taint of dark forces that have altered their flesh and their essence. And while there is general concept of what “they” look like, the fact remains that chaotic forces do not stay easily defined and qualified for long. Like their chaotic nature, they can always change for better or worse.

This list is intended for any fantasy setting (like Dungeons and Dragons, Pathfinder, Runequest, etc.) where hellish magic and dark dimensions are simply part of a complete understanding of nature. This list can easily be applied to tainted sorcerers, hell-touched witches, and the offspring of an incubus or succubus. We recommend each character get 1d3 rolls on this table subject to approval by the game master. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to any hell bent hero or villain.

boardgame.name: Last Ditch: A Strategy Game
boardgame.description:
Last Ditch is played on a free-form "board" made of intersecting straight lines with a closed border - the lines are the "ditches" of the title.

On a turn a player "fills" a ditch by scribbling over it, but if the ditch being filled intersects an already-filled ditch, it stops there.

The player filling the last ditch wins the game.

boardgame.name: Fantastic Lairs
boardgame.description:
Boss Battles and Climactic Encounters

Publisher's blurb:

Caves of the Cockatrice (1st level). A shadow-infused cockatrice keeps a stone garden in a lair built around an ancient and corrupted fey gateway.

Temple of the Centipede Cult (2nd level). A band of centipede-worshipping cultists feed living sacrifices to their pets in a fallen temple of Asmodeus.

Lair of Lord Wiskers (3rd level). A band of wererats led by the megalomaniacal Lord Whiskers gathers up all the city's silver to be destroyed in their trap-infested sewer lair.

Last Call at Nevermind (3rd level). The Dead Roses, a band of cutthroats led by the murderous bandit captain Adilia Rose, hide out between jobs in a seedy tavern built from a titan's skull.

Nature's Rage (4th level). A blood-drenched druid and a horde of beasts plot revenge against the despoilers of nature in the ruined zoo of a murdered noble.

Ashsnarl's Secrets (5th level). The half-dragon Tharandra Everflame and her kobold minions steer a machine of war and fire through defenseless villages.

Sticky Toffee (5th level). The confections at Auntie Bea's Sweet Treats are more than they seem — as is the shop's night hag proprietor.

Bumpy Ride (6th level). A mage uses his airship and an array of deadly incendiary devices to terrorize other wizards into subservience, and the characters must put an end to it.

The Lamia Job (6th level). The characters must infiltrate a mysterious bank vault to reveal the murderous plots and corrupting illusions of a lamia mastermind.

Ithrix Blackbile (7th level). A young black dragon uses his acidic breath to keep a band of trolls under his sway in an ancient cyclopean ruin.

Those Who Are About to Die (7th level). The characters face waves of brutal combatants and devastating hazards in this arena of blood, death, and fire.

Zengran's Game (7th level). From a lair in an extradimensional emporium of games, puzzles, and other wondrous entertainments, a rakshasa seeks out a group of adventurers destined for greatness.

Curse of Black Ice (8th level). Hunting in the icy wastes for decades, the frost giant werewolf’s hunting ground has expanded into more civilized lands. Now the adventurers hunt the monstrous frost giant to his lair of frozen ice and face his new bloodthirsty followers.

The Blood Palace (8th level). In a lost ziggurat of blood, a sinister spirit naga and its enthralled gnolls need the adventurers' help — to feed their hidden hydra.

Korrington Academy (9th level). An oni poses as the kindly headmaster of an academy for young sorcerers, where he uses a dark ritual to sacrifice faculty members and increase his power.

The Remembered God (10th level). Calathorr, a mighty aboleth who was once worshipped as a god, rebuilds their humanoid cult thanks to clever planning and a stroke of luck. If all goes well, Calathorr will enslave an army of followers even grander than their previous band.

Dragon Mummy's Rage (12th level). In the desert tomb of an ancient dragon queen, a dragonborn mummy lord guards a magical jewel that might destroy the world.

The World Eater (14th level). In an astral sanctum that defies natural physics, the characters battle an ancient lich responsible for the deaths of nine worlds.

Valentyne's Legacy (14th level). A cloud giant vampire moves across the sky in a red cloud castle defended by monstrous thralls and vampire spawn, drawing blood from the land and rising zombies in its wake.

The Forge of Sizzle Death (16th level). A murderous blue dragon forces fire giant captives to forge magic items in a hidden desert cave.

Blade Queen's Throne (17th level). The characters must retrieve a secret word required to save the world — but that word is protected by a powerful marilith for its demon lord master.

Hells' Heart (20th level). In a shattered celestial temple, an ancient gold dragon is possessed by a demon prince encased in a spike buried in the dragon's chest, and threatens the mystical pillar that holds the multiverse together.

Put the Monster Back (20th level). The tarrasque breaks free of a secure facility designed to hold the worst monsters of creation, and will tear through the walls of reality, devouring entire worlds unless the characters stop it.

boardgame.name: Principalita Kingdom Maps Vol. 1-F: Jungle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hinterland Mapview can help you minimize the amount of prep time for your next homebrew campaign!

Need a homebrew kingdom map but lack significant drawing skills? Need a detailed empire map calling out specific landmarks, but don’t have the time or money to spend on complex mapping software? Hinterland Mapview’s PRINCIPALITA map series can jump start your creative process by providing you with a variety of generic full color principality maps.

PRINCIPALITA Maps portray kingdoms and empires which emphasize different terrain types (such as Forest, Swamp or Desert). Each volume includes one Populated map as well as one Unpopulated map without towns or roads depicted. A small PNG file full of town icons (with a transparent background) is provided as a resource for cutting and pasting your own town icons upon the blank map.

boardgame.name: Geographica World Maps Vol. 1-A
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hinterland Mapview can help you minimize the amount of prep time for your next homebrew campaign!

Need a homebrew world map but lack significant drawing skills? Need a detailed continent map calling out specific biomes, but don’t have the time or money to spend on complex mapping software? Hinterland Mapview’s GEOGRAPHICA map series can jump start your creative process by providing you with a variety of generic full color geographical maps.

Each full color GEOGRAPHICA map delineates grasslands, desert sands, heavily forested areas, mountainous regions, landforms trapped beneath glacial ice, and depicts prominent rivers and lakes as well. Each map is essentially a blank slate for you to place cities and towns wherever you wish. Each color map is accompanied by a black & white version delineating only mountains and rivers, allowing you to sketch out your own national boundaries and clearly label prominent landmarks yourself.

boardgame.name: A Restful Shade
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A group of goblins is spreading the rumor of the tomb to lure adventurers to the woods and rob them.

There is an actual tomb there but the same goblins have not tried to get in and look for treasure for a while, they have lost too many of their own trying.

The tomb is old, buried there is the only daughter of one of the many landlords that ruled over this piece of land. The daughter was his greatest treasure and when she died the family died with her and they were eventually forgotten.

boardgame.name: SciFi Rooms
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Various rooms for quick Scifi interior construction.

Need some scifi interiors on the quick? Plop down rooms and connect them with doors to quickly layout some scifi interior spaces. Goes great with my scifi decor sets.

boardgame.name: The Vara Chronicles
boardgame.description:
A Systemless Setting of Fairy Tales and Chivalry

Publisher's blurb:

A world of adventure awaits!

Long ago an enchanted mirror was shattered, unleashing its power upon the realm of Vara. The inhabitants now face monstrous creatures who represent the darkest parts of men's souls. Only the Knights of Valor stand between the people and these wretched beasts, and only time will tell if good prevails!

The Vara Chronicles is a sytemless setting inspired by old fairy tales and folklore from a time when villains were despicable creatures, and heroes were true beacons of hope.

boardgame.name: Prose Bowl
boardgame.description:
Prose Bowl is played with a set of 21 letters; the rules suggest choosing the first 21 from some piece of written material.

A procedure is given for drafting letters from the set which results in each player having ten. The remaining letter is the "team captain" for both players.

The players then have three minutes to make words from their letters; every word must include the captain. Points are awarded based on word length and use of rare letters.

A series of three games can be played, in which case the teams are kept but the loser of a game chooses any letter as the new captain for both teams.

boardgame.name: Coasts
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

ntroduces a new biome, its signature plants, and a handy list of descriptors for all of the senses - now your player characters can not only 'see' but also 'hear', 'smell', 'taste', and 'feel' the world around them. Devised as a quick reference during the game, each PDF covers one specific type of terrain.

boardgame.name: Freshwater Marshes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You're walking through the forest... There are trees... Oaks, pines... Some shrubs... Uhh...

"So, what's growing over there, GM?"

ntroduces a new biome, its signature plants, and a handy list of descriptors for all of the senses - now your player characters can not only 'see' but also 'hear', 'smell', 'taste', and 'feel' the world around them. Devised as a quick reference during the game, each PDF covers one specific type of terrain.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

boardgame.name: The High Seas
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

As you travel through the snow for the third day, huddled and barely paying attention to your surroundings...

... No, we're keeping watch! I want to roll Perception! What do I see?

Let me roll on the encounter table, I had it somewhere... Uh, you see 1d6 goblins hiding behind that tree.

Now, imagine you don't have to do that.

boardgame.name: The Forest Trails
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The cards introduce a variety of encounters and don't dictate the solutions. You're never forced to fight whatever you've found, and the player have a full agency to do whatever they wish. There are no stat blocks and no answers to the mysteries - you're free to take the situation wherever the inspiration takes you.

boardgame.name: On Top of the World
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

As you travel through the snow for the third day, huddled and barely paying attention to your surroundings...

... No, we're keeping watch! I want to roll Perception! What do I see?

Let me roll on the encounter table, I had it somewhere... Uh, you see 1d6 goblins hiding behind that tree.
